alert.note: Alert for Gloucester; James City; King and Queen; Mathews; Middlesex; New Kent; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 27 at 12:24PM EDT until May 27 at 1:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Gloucester County in eastern Virginia... Southern Middlesex County in eastern Virginia... Southeastern King and Queen County in east central Virginia... Northwestern York County in southeastern Virginia... Northwestern Mathews County in eastern Virginia... East central New Kent County in east central Virginia... Eastern James City County in southeastern Virginia... * Until 115 PM EDT. * At 1224 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Toano to Queens Lake, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Gloucester Courthouse, Glenns and Hayes around 1240 PM EDT. Saluda around 1245 PM EDT. Urbanna around 1250 PM EDT. Hartfield and Blakes around 1255 PM EDT. Deltaville around 100 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Croaker, Camp Peary, Harmony Village, Grafton, Harcum, Cash, Amburg, Ewell, Greys Point and Allmondsville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM EDT for east central Virginia. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for eastern and southeastern Virginia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM EDT for east central Virginia. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for eastern and southeastern Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Gloucester; James City; King and Queen; Mathews; Middlesex; New Kent; York
